brief_summary.textblock:
To identify risk factors for aggressiveness in Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the skin in organ
      transplant recipients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Aggressive Squamous Cell Carcinoma in Organ Transplant Recipients

detailed_description.textblock:
Squamous Cell Carcinomas (SCC) are one of the most common skin cancers. They belong to the
      epithelial neoplasm of the skin, which manifest a local aggressive growth and have potential
      for metastasis. Organ transplant recipients have a hundredfold higher incidence of SCC.

      Unfortunately the primary tumor, regional nodes, metastasis (TNM)-Classification for the
      prognosis of SCC in this group of patient has not yet been established. Therefore there are
      no standardised criteria for evaluation of local recurrence or prognosis.

      The aim of this study is to identify criteria, which permit a risk assessment relating to
      aggressiveness of SCC.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Organ transplant recipients with:

          -  > 9 SCC in total or

          -  > 2 SCC per year (in any one year) or

          -  any single "index" SCC that has a very poorly differentiated cell morphology or that
             behaved aggressively in Terms of local recurrence or local/systemic metastasis

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Non organ transplant recipients

study_pop.textblock:
Organ Transplant Recipients with:

          -  > 9 Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC) in total or

          -  > 2 SCC per year (in any one year) or

          -  any single "index" SCC that has a very poorly differentiated cell morphology or that
             behaved aggressively in Terms of local recurrence or local/systemic metastasis

clinical_study.official_title: Aggressive Squamous Cell Carcinoma in Organ Transplant Recipients

other_outcome.description: Measurements will be assessed with questionnaire from about 150 participants.

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Zurich, Division of Dermatology

primary_outcome.description:
Location
exact size in mm
histological classification (well-differentiated, moderately-differentiated, poorly differentiated, spindle cell morphology, desmoplastic, basi-squamous, acantholytic)
Invasion
rapid growth
local recurrence
sentinel node sampling
Metastasis

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description:
skin type
hair colour
eye colour
freckles
cumulative UV exposure
Measurements will be assessed with questionnaire from about 150 participants.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Retrospective
